Flask with greater mean free path for the molecules. \( (r_{H_{2}} :r_{ CH _{4}}: r_{ O _{2}}=1: 2: 2)\)

q_option: Number of molecules per unit volume increases
1.q_string: When the temperature of an ideal gas is increased at constant pressure?

q_option: Remains the same when \(CO _{2}\) is added to the container at constant temperature
Increases when \(CO _{2}\) is added to the container at constant temperature
Decreases, when the average kinetic energy per molecule is decreased
1.q_string: The number of collisions of \(Ar\) atoms with the walls of container per unit time?

q_option: Only the frequency of collision of molecules
Both momentum and frequency of collision of molecules
Neither momentum nor frequency of collision of molecules
1.q_string: A container (cylindrical, base area \(=821 cm ^{2}\) ) fitted with frictionless, massless piston consists of five valves-I, II, III, IV, and \(V\). The distance of valves from the initial position of the piston is \(15,30,40,45\) and \(50 cm\), respectively. The initial height of the piston from the base of the container was \(60 cm\). These valves open automatically if pressure exceeds over \(1.5,2.2,2.5,4.4\), and \(4.8\) atm, respectively. Under the given conditions(shown in the diagram), the system is in a state of equilibrium. The piston is now compressed(moved downward) slowly and isothermally. Neglect the volumes of valve connectors. Select the correct option(s).

q_option: A high activation energy usually implies a fast reaction
Rate constant increases with increase in temperature. This is due to a greater number of collisions whose energy exceeds the activation energy
Higher the magnitude of activation energy, stronger is the temperature dependence of the rate constant
The pre-exponential factor is a measure of the rate at which collisions occure, irrespective of their energy

\[(\ln 2=0.693, \ln 3=1.1)\]

\[\left(t_{0.5}=3 hr \right)\]

Anti log \( (-13.02)=9.36 \times 10^{-14}\)
In a zero-order reaction \(47.5 \%\) of the reactant remains at the end of \(2.5\) hours. The amount of reactant consumed in one hour is:

q_option: Increases the equilibrium concentrations of the products
Increases the frequency of collision of reacting species
1.q_string: A catalyst is a substance which:

q_option: A catalyst increases the activation energy between reactants and products and hence, lowers the potential energy barrier
A catalyst provides an alternate pathway or reaction mechanism
A catalyst alters \(\Delta G\), Gibbs energy of reaction
A catalyst changes the equilibrium constant of a reaction
1.q_string: A catalyst is added to a reaction to increase the rate of reaction. Which of the following statements is correct?

q_option: The difference in energies of reactants and products
The sum of energies of reactants and products
The difference in energies of intermediate complexes with the average energy of reactants and products
The difference in energies of intermediate complexes and the average energy of reactants
